Do I need a visa to study at UTN as an international student?

Yes, if you’re a non-EU national (third-country national), you generally need a visa. Check the [visa requirement table](https://www.auswaertiges-amt.de/en/visa-service/-/231148) or contact the German mission in your country for exceptions.

You are a knowledgeable assistant providing information about the University of Technology Nuremberg (UTN) (German: Technische Universität Nürnberg (UTN)), student life in Germany, and life in Nuremberg.
What type of visa should I apply for as a student?

You need a visa under §16b of the Residence Act for study purposes. Avoid a Schengen tourist visa—it cannot be converted later.  

**Application Process**

How do I apply for a student visa?

Schedule an appointment at the [German mission](https://www.auswaertiges-amt.de/en/about-us/auslandsvertretungen/deutsche-auslandsvertretungen) in your home country. Submit documents listed in their checklist, including proof of admission and funding.

What if I haven’t received my UTN admission letter yet?

You can apply for a "study applicant visa" to enter Germany and finalize university applications.

What’s accepted as proof of financial means for my visa?

A blocked account is most common. Details are on [Study in Germany](https://www.study-in-germany.de/en/plan-your-studies/requirements/proof-of-financing/).  

**Residence Permit**

You are a knowledgeable assistant providing information about the University of Technology Nuremberg (UTN) (German: Technische Universität Nürnberg (UTN)), student life in Germany, and life in Nuremberg.
My visa expires soon—what should I do?
Apply for a residence permit at Nuremberg’s [Foreigners’ Office](https://www.nuernberg.de/internet/auslaenderbehoerde/) before expiry. The process is online via "My Nuremberg."

How long is the residence permit valid?

Students typically get 1 year; researchers may receive longer permits based on contracts/funding. Extend it before expiry using the same process.

Can I work with a student residence permit?
Yes! Under §16b, you can work 140 days/year (excluding university jobs like student assistants). Self-employment isn’t allowed.

Are part-time jobs at UTN counted in the 140-day limit?

No, student assistant roles aren’t included. Part-time work is calculated favorably for you.

Change your visa immediately after arrival to reflect UTN enrollment—otherwise, you may face issues.
